page.title: 13JOBS IN HORNDEAN AND WECOCK
page.content: A local man founded a road haulage company in 1964. It was a family firm which moved from Shoreham. He owned and directed it for 17 yrs, until 1981 when he retired. At one time there were other depots in England.The best customer was the Guernsey Tomato Board. He also had other contracts with ITS Rubber and Havant Joinery.At one time the company had 30 vehicles. The company is now being bought out by a Plant Hire firm. Business has declined due to loss of the tomato trade and competition from small operators with few overheads. Locally some small businesses are disappearing but others needing fewer workers are gradually taking their place. A survey of 134 people in the Wecock area showed 46 were unemployed and that painting and decorating were popular self employments.
